stanza.line: No more be grieved at that which thou hast (a)done(/a)
Roses have thorns and silver fountains (b)mud(/b)
Clouds and eclipses stain both moon and (a)sun(/a)
And loathsome canker lives in sweetest (b)bud(/b)
All men make faults and even I in (c)this(/c)
Excusing thy sins more than thy sins (d)are(/d)
For to thy sensual fault I bring in (e)sense(/e)
And 'gainst my self a lawful plea (e)commence(/e)
Such civil war is in my love and (f)hate(/f)
That I an accessary needs must (g)be(/g)
To that sweet thief which sourly robs from (g)me(/g)
